CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 11, 1947, pg. 10, reads: "Greenlee - Murrell Rites - The wedding party of Miss Eva Ruth Greenlee and Dr. Peter C. Murrell is shown following their last week marriage. Attendants were Dr. Ronald Williams and Miss Jane Greenlee. - Harris Photo."  Portions of article read: "Eva Ruth Greenlee, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Albert Greenlee of Bryn Mawr Road, was married Sunday afternoon to Dr. Peter Charles Murrell, son of Mrs. Nellie Murrell of Glasgon, Ky.  The Rev. Dr. T. J. King, pastor of the Ebenezer Baptist performed the impressive double-ring ceremony at the home of the bride's parents.  Wears Orchid - The bride wore a deep orchid colored dress with pink accessories and an orchid corsage.  She carried a white prayer book.  The bride's sister, her only attendant, wore a gray satin dress and a corsage of red roses.  Dr. M. Ronald Williams of Los Angeles, Calif., was best man...Out-of-town relatives attending the wedding included the bride's cousins, Mr. and Mrs. James A. Williams of Cleveland, and the groom's uncle and aunt, Mr. and Mrs. B. H. Murrell of Louisville, Ky... "
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of two women, including one on left wearing dress with beaded or studded top, eyeglasses, and dark lace fingerless gloves, and man wearing dark three piece suit, standing in Greenlee home on Bryn Mawr Road, for Greenlee - Murrell wedding
